intro: Spergularia pitardiana, commonly known as the pitardian sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or arid environments. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Spergularia pitardiana is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in challenging climates.
